icnCatalogTool.description: The ICN catalog tool is used to resolve ICNs (Illustrated Parts Catalog Numbers) to filenames and notations. It uses an XML-based catalog file to map ICNs to their corresponding resolutions.

commandLineOptions.option: -c, --catalog: Specify the path to the ICN catalog file.

attributes.attribute: publicId: The optional PUBLIC ID of the notation.
systemId: The optional SYSTEM ID of the notation.
name: The identifier of the output media.
type: The type of ICN entry, with one of the following values: "single" (D): Specifies a single ICN to resolve. "pattern": Specifies a pattern to resolve one or more ICNs.
infoEntityIdent: The ICN, or pattern used to match ICNs.
uri: The filename the ICN will resolve to.
notation: A reference to a previously declared <notation> element.

icnPatternRules.description: By default, each catalog entry matches a single ICN, but multiple ICNs can be resolved with a single entry by using a pattern rule. An entry with attribute type="pattern" specifies a regular expression to use to match ICNs and a template used to construct the resolved URI.

useCases.useCase: Resolving ICNs to filenames and notations for a specific output media type.
Using pattern rules to resolve multiple ICNs with a single catalog entry.
Creating an ICN catalog file that maps ICNs to their corresponding resolutions.
